data.title: The Best Detroit Pistons Centers of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 400 sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best Detroit Pistons Centers of All Time. Current Top 3: Ben Wallace, Bob Lanier, Bill Laimbeer
data.text:
Ranked By

1.8K votes

422 voters

4 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Detroit Pistons

Latest additions: James Wiseman

Most divisive: Larry Foust

Over 400 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Detroit Pistons Centers of All Time

Big fan of Detroit basketball? Then check out this list of Detroit Pistons centers. It includes almost every center from throughout Detroit Pistons history, including current centers and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA centers of all time, the best Pistons Cs include Ben Wallace, Bob Lanier, Andre Drummond, Bill Laimbeer, and Rick Mahorn.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Detroit Pistons starting Cs and backup Cs are Isaiah Stewart, Kelly Olynyk, and Luke Garza.

Who are the best centers in Detroit Pistons history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Detroit Pistons centers of all time!

Birthplace : White Hall, Alabama

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Detroit Pistons, Chicago Bulls, Cleveland Cavaliers, Orlando Magic

Position : Center

Detroit Pistons: 2000–2006, 2009–2012

Undrafted in 1996, Ben Wallace signed with the Detroit Pistons in 2000 and would go on to be known for his relentless work ethic and tenacious defense. Anchoring the paint for the Pistons, he played a pivotal role in their 2004 NBA Championship run. Throughout his time with the team, Wallace garnered four NBA Defensive Player of the Year awards, five All-NBA team selections, and six All-Defensive team selections, making him an indisputable Pistons legend.

Birthplace : Buffalo, New York

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Center

Detroit Pistons: 1970–1980

Drafted in 1970 as the first overall pick, Bob Lanier quickly solidified his spot as one of the best centers to ever don a Detroit Pistons jersey. Known for his agile footwork and soft shooting touch, the eight-time All-Star was a force to be reckoned with, both offensively and defensively. During his tenure with the Pistons, Lanier accumulated an impressive resume, highlighted by his six appearances on the All-NBA team and being named the 1974 NBA All-Star Game MVP.

Birthplace : Boston, Massachusetts

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Detroit Pistons, Cleveland Cavaliers

Position : Center

Detroit Pistons: 1981–1994

Acquired through a trade in 1982, Bill Laimbeer instantly made a name for himself with his hard-nosed, physical playstyle that epitomized the "Bad Boys" era Pistons. His aggressive approach helped lead the team to back-to-back NBA Championships in 1989 and 1990. A four-time All-Star, Laimbeer's rebounding prowess and ability to stretch the floor with his reliable outside shooting were invaluable assets to the franchise during his tenure.

Birthplace : Mount Vernon, New York

Nationality : American

Team : Chicago Bulls

Position : Center

Detroit Pistons: 2012–2020

Drafted by the Pistons in 2012, Andre Drummond made an immediate impact with his exceptional athleticism and ferocious rebounding abilities. A two-time All-Star while with Detroit, his presence in the paint was both feared and respected by opponents. Drummond recorded numerous league-leading rebounding performances and made history in 2016 as the youngest player to reach 4,000 career rebounds.

Birthplace : Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Portland Trail Blazers, Detroit Pistons, Atlanta Hawks, Washington Wizards, Boston Celtics

Position : Power forward

Detroit Pistons: 2003–2009

Acquired in a trade during the 2003-04 season, Rasheed Wallace quickly became an integral part of the Pistons' NBA Championship run that year. Known for his versatility both offensively and defensively, Wallace's skill set perfectly complemented Detroit's playing style. A four-time All-Star, his post-up moves and ability to stretch the floor with his three-point shooting earned him high praise from both fans and peers alike.

Birthplace : Greensboro, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

Detroit Pistons: 1979–1981

Traded to the Pistons in 1979, Bob McAdoo was already an established NBA superstar, having won three scoring titles and an MVP award earlier in his career. Although his tenure with Detroit was brief, McAdoo's scoring prowess and ability to space the floor remained significant assets for the team. His scoring talents were on full display during the 1980-81 season when he averaged an impressive 22.1 points per game.
